credits.transcribedBy: guineapig <shadelet@easynet.co.uk>, Ruth Curran, Mindy Mattingly Phillips, Josh Hodge, Dan Silverstein & Eric Aasen.

content.description: Central Perk, Joey and Chandler are sitting and talking.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know what? It seems like all of the sudden; so much has happened.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I know. Ross is getting married.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Phoebe is, making people.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Everybody’s doing stuff!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And we just sit here. I mean if I die the only way people would even know I was here, would be by the ass print on this chair! Look, we have to do something. Okay? Something huge!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: We could climb Mt. Everest!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No-no, not something stupid, something huge.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No-no-no-no-no, I saw an ad for this video, people climb that thing everyday! We could totally do that!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Why not?! I mean it’s just, it’s just climbing! It’s just, it’s just steep!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: We’re going to Everest! Okay, it would be nice to leave an ass print on Everest!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What-what’s up?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: We’re gonna climb Mt. Everest!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah baby!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Really?! I looked into that. Yeah, but, I mean it costs like $60,000 and y’know you can die. And, you would die!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, well…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: We could get that Everest video though.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, we could do that without y’know risking our lives at all!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: And while we’re down at the video store, you know what else we could rent? Die Hard ! (Chandler’s excited.) Oh, y’know what? I just remembered, that Everest thing is only available through mail order.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, well…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So you guys’ll stay here and hang out with me?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeeeeahhhh.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah. Yeah.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: But I’ll tell you something. One of these days we’re get off of our buts and rent Die Hard again!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah we are!

content.description: Ross’s apartment, he and Emily are addressing their invitations.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: So what did he decide? Does your Uncle Nathan get an invite or not?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ohh, God, nobody likes him, and he’s so cheap, he’d never fly to London in a million years. Yeah, invite him? Hey, did I do these neat enough? (Hands her some envelopes.)

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Yeah, they’re fine.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: If anyone asks, we’ll just say Ben addressed them. (Looking through the envelopes.) Oh! So you invited Rachel then?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Sure. Why not?

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: I don’t think I’d be comfortable with any of my old lovers there.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wait-wait-wait, do you, do you think, maybe we shouldn’t invite her?

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Oh, no-no, y’know I absolutely adore Rachel it’s just that, well it might be a awkward for you. But it’s absolutely your decision. (Gets up.) More tea?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah sure.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Earl Grey?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Huh? Yeah, fine, invite whoever you want.
[And with that we start off on a series of clips from the entire history of Ross and Rachel, from Ross’s point of view. The first clip is from The Pilot.]

content.description: Central Perk, Ross is complaining about Carol.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I don’t want to be single, okay? I just… I just- I just wanna be married again!
(ENTER Rachel IN A WET WEDDING DRESS. SHE STARTS TO SEARCH AROUND THE ROOM)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And I just want a million dollars! (EXTENDS HIS HAND HOPEFULLY)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Rachel?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh God Monica hi! I just went to your building and you weren’t there and then this guy with a big hammer said you might be here and you are, you are!
[cut to later]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, everybody, this is Rachel, another Lincoln High survivor. (TO Rachel) This is everybody, this is Chandler, and Phoebe, and Joey, and- you remember my brother Ross?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi, sure!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi.
(THEY GO TO HUG BUT ROSs’ UMBRELLA OPENS. HE SITS, DEFEATED AGAIN)
[cut to later]

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Ross and Rachel are finishing up some cookies.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You know you probably didn’t know this, but back in high school, I had a, um, major crush on you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I knew.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You did! Oh… I always figured you just thought I was Monica’s geeky older brother.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I did.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh. Listen, do you think- and try not to let my intense vulnerability become any kind of a factor here- but do you think it would be okay if I asked you out? Sometime? Maybe?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, maybe…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay… okay, maybe I will…
[The next clip is from The One With The Blackout.]

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Ross and Rachel are talking about passion.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: See, I see… big passion in your future.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I do.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh Ross, you’re so great. [she playfully rubs his head and gets up]
[Ross gets up, pleased with himself and starts to walk past Joey.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It’s never gonna happen.
[cut to later]

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s balcony, Ross is about to be attacked by Paulo’s cat.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, I have a question. Well, actually, it’s not so much a question as.. more of a general wondering… ment.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: OK.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: OK. Umm, for a while now, I’ve been wanting to, um…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohhh!!!! [looking at something behind Ross]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes, yes, that’s right…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, look at the little cat! [a small kitten is on the roof behind Ross] Look at it!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What? [the cat jumps on his shoulders] Ow!

content.description: Inside. Monica, Joey and Phoebe are singing while outside, Ross and Rachel are trying to get the cat off of Ross’ shoulder.

content.speaker: Monica, Joey, and Phoebe
content.text: [singing] I’m on top of the world, looking down on creation and the only explanation I can find…
[The next clip is from The One With The East German Laundry Detergent.]

content.description: The Laundromat, Rachel is fighting with that old, annoying woman for a cart.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right, listen, missy. If you want this cart, you’re gonna have to take me with it!
[She thinks it over, and then walks away.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: [to Ross] Yes! Did you see that?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You were incredible! Brand new woman, ladies and gentlemen.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I could not have done this without you.
[Rachel stands up and kisses Ross. He is stunned. A moment of silence follows.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ok, um, uh, more clothes in the dryer? [Ross turns and bangs his head on an open dryer door.] I’m fine, I’m fine.
[The next clip is from The One Where Ross Finds Out]

content.description: Central Perk, I’m sure you’ve guessed, it’s the famous fight scene between Ross and Rachel.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You had no right to tell me you ever had feelings for me.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: [hurt] What?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I was doing great with Julie before I found out about you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey, I was doin’ great before I found out about you. You think it’s easy for me to see you with Julie?
[cut to later]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: The point is I… I don’t need this right now, OK. It, it’s too late, I’m with somebody else, I’m happy. This ship has sailed.
[cut to later]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Alright, fine, you go ahead and you do that, alright Ross.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Fine.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: ’Cause I don’t need your stupid ship.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Good.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Good. [Ross leaves]
[cut to later]

[Rachel slams the door and locks it. She sits down, visibly upset. She puts her head in her hands and begins to cry. Ross comes back and is standing outside the window. When Rachel regroups and gets back up to finish closing, she sees him.]
[cut to later]
[She opens the door and they kiss.]
[The next clip is the second famous fight in The One Where Ross and Rachel Take A Break.]

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Ross and Rachel are arguing.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross do you realise this is the first time in my life I’m doing something I actually care about. This is the first time in my life I’m doing something that I’m actually good at. I mean. if you don’t get that…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, hey, I get that, okay, I get that big time. And I’m happy for ya, but I’m tired of having a relationship with your answering machine! Okay, I don’t know what to do anymore.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well neither do I!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Is this about Mark?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, it’s not, it’s not.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God. I cannot keep having this same fight over and over again, Ross, no, you’re, you’re, you’re making this too hard.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh I’m, I’m making this too hard. Okay, what do you want me to do.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I don’t know, I don’t know. Urrrgh! Look, maybe we should take a break.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, okay, fine, you’re right. Let’s ah, let’s take a break, (goes to the door) let’s cool off, okay, let’s get some frozen yogart, or something.. (opens the door)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No. (Ross is standing in the doorway.) A break from us.
(Ross looks at her, then leaves slamming the door behind him.)
[The next clip is from The One The Morning After]

content.description: Ross’s apartment, Ross is hurrying Chloe out the door.

content.speaker: Chloe
content.text: Do I know why we’re rushing?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, y’know the ah, the girlfriend I told you about last night? (He’s frantically throwing the cushions off of the couch looking for her other shoe) Well it turns out she ah, she wants to get back together with me. Oh, I found it!!

content.speaker: Chloe
content.text: That’s so great for you guys!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah!
[cut to later]

content.speaker: Chloe
content.text: Good luck, with your girlfriend.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, thank you. (She goes to kiss him, but he holds her coat up between their faces to stop her.) Hey, hey. (opens the door, sees Rachel, and hides Chloe behind the door) Rachel!!!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi. Ohhh, you got my message.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, oh hey, you are right on time.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So what do you say? Can I be your girlfriend again?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes, you can, very much.
(Chloe gives Ross the thumbs up while still standing behind the door.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ahhhh!! (Hugs Rachel tighter.)
[cut to later]

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Rachel has just found out about Chloe and is screaming at Ross. The rest of the gang is trapped in Monica’s bedroom.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Y’know what, I want you to leave! Get outta here!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Just get out! Now!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No!! No!! I wanna stay. I wanna talk about this.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay! All right! How was she?
[Cut to Monica’s bedroom]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Uh-oh.
[Cut to Living Room]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Was she good?
[Cut to Monica’s bedroom]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Don’t answer that.
[Cut to Living Room]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Come on Ross! You said you wanted to talk about it, let’s talk about it!! How was she?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: She was…
[Cut to Monica’s bedroom]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Awful! Horrible!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: She was not good. Not good.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: She was nothing compared to you.
[Cut to Living Room]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: She, she was different.
[Cut to Monica’s bedroom]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ewwwww!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Uh-oh.
[Cut to Living Room]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Good different?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Nobody likes change.
(Rachel picks up a newspaper and starts beating him with it.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What? Okay, okay, okay, okay.
[The next clip is from The One With The Jellyfish.]

content.description: Rachel’s bedroom, Rachel, entering selfish mode, is thanking Ross for wrongly taking the entire blame of the breakup; as if she had absolutely nothing to do with it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: …the way you owned up to everything, it just showed me how much you’ve grown. Y’know? I mean my Mom never thought this would work out. It was all, “Once a cheater, always a cheater.” Ooh, I just wish we hadn’t lost those four months, but if time was what you needed just to gain a little perspective…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: WE WERE ON A BREAK!!!!!!!
[Cut back to the present.]

content.description: A mailbox, Ross is mailing the invitations. He throws a bunch into the mailbox, but pauses with Rachel’s. And it starts another round of clips.

content.text: [The One With The Fake Party]

content.description: The hallway, Rachel is convincing Ross that Emily is good for him.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You seem to really like her.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, I really do. Yeah, but what am I gonna do, I mean we-we both agreed that it was gonna be a two-week thing, y’know no commitment.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross, that girl just spent the entire evening talking to your friends, asking to hear stories about you, looking through Monica’s photo albums, I mean you don’t do that if you’re just in it for two weeks.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You think?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, you got like 14 hours until she has to be at the airport, and you’re sitting here in the hallway with a 28-year-old cheerleader with a fat lip.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, you’re right.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah.
[Cut back to the present, Ross is still looking at Rachel’s invitation. Finally, he makes up his mind and mails it.]

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Joey, Monica, and Phoebe are opening their invitations.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ohh, this is soo amazing! I can’t believe my brother’s getting married! And in London! It’s so romantic!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, pretty smart! Tissue paper! You’re at the wedding, you have to cry, “Handkerchief?” “No-no, I got my invitation.”

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oooh look! Isn’t this adorable, Ross let Ben address mine!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hello!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey! Hey, did you get your invitation to Ross’s wedding?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Noo.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Don’t worry man, I get to bring a guest. We’ll show him.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m so jealous you’re all going! I can’t believe I never knew that you can’t fly in your third trimester!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I didn’t know that.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I never knew that either.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I knew that! (They all look at him) I sooo didn’t know that, but you should see your faces.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey guys! What’s up?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Heyyy. (They all try and hide their invitations.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: We’re hanging out.
(Rachel starts going through her mail, and come across her invitation.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What’s this? Is this Ross’s wedding invitation?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: See, maybe that’s the one we should’ve actually hidden.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, no! No you guys! Come on, you don’t have to do that! I’m happy for him! I am! I really—I’m-I’m happ—I’ll work on it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m sorry honey.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Rach, you’re gonna come though aren’t you?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, honey, I don’t know. I…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: This isn’t one of those uh, y’know “If she doesn’t come, we-we don’t, we don’t come?” Right? Because I already bought my ticket…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You know what would be real weird? Is if you weren’t there. Just say you’ll think about it, okay?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, I’ll think about it. Yeah.
[And with that, we go into another set of clips, this time from Rachel’s point of view.]
[The first clip is from The One Where Rachel Finds Out.]

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, it’s Rachel birthday party and Chandler is about to spill the beans.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Who’s this from?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, that’s Ross’s.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh… [opens it]… [sees it is a pin] Oh my God. He remembered.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Remembered what?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: It was like months ago. We were walking by this antique store, and I saw this pin in the window, and I told him that it was just like one my grandmother had when I was a little girl. Oh! I can’t believe he remembered!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, it’s so pretty. This must have cost him a fortune.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I can’t believe he did this.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Come on, Ross? Remember back in college, when he fell in love with Carol and bought her that ridiculously expensive crystal duck?
[Everyone looks at him. He realizes he just spilled the beans about Ross’s crush on Rachel.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What did you just say?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: [stuttering incoherently] F-hah… flennin…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh… my God.
[The next clip is from The One With Ross’s New Girlfriend.]

content.description: The airport, Ross is about to walk off of the plane with Julie.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God.
content.parenthetical: seeing Ross come off the plane with another woman.

content.text: [cut to later]

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Ross is introducing Julie to the gang.

content.speaker: Julie
content.text: Well, Ross and I were in grad school together.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: But we haven’t seen each other since then. Well I land in China, guess who’s in charge of the dig.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Julie! Julie, isn’t that great? I mean, isn’t that just kick- you-in-the-crotch, spit-on-your-neck fantastic?
[cut to later]

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Ross is trying to hang up on Julie.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, that is so sweet.(listens) No, no, ok, you hang up. Ok, ok, one, two, three.(He doesn’t hang up and motions for Rachel to be quiet.) Well you didn’t hang up either.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: She didn’t hang up either…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ok, no, no, you hang up. You, you, y— (Rachel grabs the phone and hangs it up for him.)
[The next clip is from The One Where Ross Finds Out.]

content.description: [Scene, A Restaurant, Rachel is on her date, drunk, and is leaving that answering machine message.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: [on phone] Ross, hi, it’s Rachel. I’m just calling to say that um, everything’s fine and I’m really happy for you and your cat …(cut)…I am over you. I am over you and that, my friend, is what they call closure. [hangs up and tosses phone in the ice bucket]
[cut to later]

content.description: [Scene, Monica and Rachel’s, the next morning, Ross is checking his messages.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Rach, I got a message from you.
[Rachel comes out of her room, suddenly she remembers leaving the message.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God. Oh my God Ross, no, hang up the phone, give me the phone Ross, give me the phone, give me the phone, give me the… [jumps the couch and lands on Ross’s back, finally getting the phone from him. Ross has a confused expression on his face.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You’re over me?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohhhhhhhh God. [climbs off his back]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wha… you’re uh, you’re, you’re over me?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh, ohh.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: When, when were you… under me?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, basically, lately, I’ve uh, I’ve uh, sort of had feelings for you.
[cut to later in the same scene]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: OK, I need to lie down.
[The next clip is from The One With The List.]

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Ross has just broken up with Julie and is about to get with Rachel.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: He broke up with Julie. Well, go hug her, for god’s sakes.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Really. It’s always been you, Rach.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, god.
[Ross and Rachel hug.]

content.speaker: Chandler and Joey
content.text: Ohhh.
[The next clip is from The One Where Ross and Rachel… You Know.]

content.description: The Auditorium, Ross and Rachel are about to… you know.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’ve no idea, could be. Listen, I’m sorry I had to work tonight.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh it’s OK. You were worth the wait, and I don’t just mean tonight.
[They kiss and start undressing. As Rachel tries to pull off Ross’s tie she catches it in his mouth. Then they roll across the fur rug.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ah, oh God. Oh, honey, oh that’s OK.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What. Oh no, you just rolled over the juice box.
[The next clip is from The One The Morning After.]

content.description: Central Perk, Ross is trying to prevent Gunther from spilling the beans.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Gunther! Gunther. Gunther, please tell me you didn’t say anything to Rachel about me and the girl from the Xerox place.

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: I’m sorry. Was I not supposed to?
(Ross turns around and sees Rachel sitting by the window. She is just glaring at him.)
[The next clip is from The One At The Beach.]

content.description: The beachhouse, Ross and Rachel are argueing about the breakup.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Y’know, hey! You’re the one who ended it, remember?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, because I was mad at you, not because I stopped loving you!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You still love me?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Noo.
[cut to later]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What does this mean? What do you, I mean do you wanna, get back together?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Noo! Maybe! I, I don’t know.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I just, I feel, I-I just…
(Ross leans in and kisses her. They both look at each other for a moment, and then embrace in a more passionate kiss.)
[The next clip is from The One With The Jellyfish.]

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Rachel and Ross are finally breaking up for good, or is it?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Y’know I can’t believe I even thought about getting back together again! We are so over!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: FINE BY ME!! (he opens the door and traps Chandler behind it)
[cut to later]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And hey! Just so you know, it’s not that common! It doesn’t happen to every guy! And it is a big deal!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I KNEW IT!!!!
[cut back to the present.]

content.description: Central Perk, Rachel is deciding on whether or not to go to the wedding.

content.text: [cut to another clip, this one is from The One With The Prom Video]

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, the gang is watching the Prom Video and Rachel is about to make her entrance on the video. The italics are portions of the prom video.

content.text: MRS. GELLER: Rachel’s coming up the path. Doesn’t she look pretty. Jack… [Rachel enters with a huge nose]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You know what this is, this is us getting ready for the prom.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You know what, you guys, we don’t have to watch this.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Oh yeah we do. C’mon.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Get a shot of Monica. Where’s Monica.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Wait, how do you zoom out? [zooms out and we see an extremely overweight Monica eating a big sandwich] There she is.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Shut up, the camera adds ten pounds.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ahh, so how many cameras are actually on you?
[cut to later]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, dad, turn it off.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: It is off. Right Ross? [pans over to see Ross with an afro and moustache]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Lookin’ good Mr. Cotter.
[cut to later]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I can’t go to my own prom without a date, I can’t, it’s too late.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: If you’re not going then I don’t want to go either.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: [to Ross on the stairs] I have a wonderful idea. You should take Rachel to the prom.
[cut to later]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Y’know what? I think we’ve seen enough, let’s turn it off.

content.speaker: All
content.text: No, no, no.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: OK, fine, well I’m not gonna watch, alright.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: C’mon kid, let’s go.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Ahh, are you hadsome.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Let’s show ’em.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: [walks down the stairs and grabs the flowers out of the vase on the endtable] OK dad.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: [going downstairs] Rachel, ready or not, here comes your knight in shining… no. [Chip has shown up and the four are leaving]

content.speaker: Rachel, Monica, Roy, and Chip
content.text: Bye.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Oh, dear. Jack, how do I turn this off?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I can’t believe you did that.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, well.
[Rachel, seeing what he did for her, gets up, walks across the room, and kisses Ross]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: See, he’s her lobster.
[Cut back to the present, Rachel has made her decision.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Nooooo. You’re really not going?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah. It’s just gonna be too hard. Y’know? I mean, it’s Ross. How can I watch him get married? Y’know it’s just, it’s for the best, y’know it is, it’s… Y’know, plus, somebody’s got to stay here with Phoebe! Y’know she’s gonna be pretty big by then, and she needs someone to help her tie her shoes; drive her to the hospital in case she goes into labour.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You don’t have a car. And your license expired.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I know. (Starts to cry) Yeah, see, there’s so much to do and I have so little time to do it in.

content.description: Central Perk, Chandler, Joey, and Phoebe are reading a book about things to do whilst in London.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right, check it out. Check this out. It says here that there’s a place you can go to rent videos of all the museums! (Reading from the book.) “It’s almost as good as being there.”

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It’s better! You can’t go to a museum in your underwear!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, You could, but… probably just the one time.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I bet we could get videos of all the sites, get a VCR in our hotel room… we’d never even have to go outside!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: If we do that, we gotta get Die Hard.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh-ho! I bet the British version is gooooood!
